modules.description: Converts exceptions to human-readable strings, using position and message data. Operates on a type representing XML positions and error messages. Used to generate detailed error reports during XML parsing.

Converts exceptions to human-readable strings, using position and message data. Operates on a type representing XML positions and error messages. Used to generate detailed error reports during XML parsing.

Converts exceptions to human-readable strings, using position and message data. Operates on a type representing XML positions and error messages. Used to generate detailed error reports during XML parsing.

Converts exceptions to human-readable strings, using position and message data. Operates on a type representing XML positions and error messages. Used to generate detailed error reports during XML parsing.

Converts exceptions to human-readable strings, using position and message data. Operates on a type representing XML positions and error messages. Used to generate detailed error reports during XML parsing.

Provides error handling and reporting during XML parsing by converting exceptions into human-readable strings using position and message data. Includes a type for representing XML positions and error messages, along with functions to format and display errors. Allows developers to track and debug parsing issues with precise contextual information. For example, it can generate a report indicating an unexpected element at line 42, column 15.

Provides error handling and reporting for XML parsing by converting exceptions into readable messages based on position and content. Includes a type for tracking XML positions and associated error messages. Allows developers to generate detailed diagnostics during parsing failures. Can be used to log or display precise error locations and descriptions in RSS 2.0 data processing.

Provides error handling and reporting for XML parsing by converting exceptions into readable messages tied to specific positions in the input. Operates on a type that tracks XML positions and associated error messages, enabling precise diagnostics. This allows developers to identify and debug issues in Atom feeds with detailed contextual information. For example, it can report that a malformed tag was found at line 12, column 32.

Provides functions to parse and manipulate OPML 1.0 documents, focusing on error handling and structured data representation. Includes a type for tracking XML positions and error messages, enabling precise error reporting. Supports operations like parsing XML into structured outlines and converting errors into readable formats. Can be used to validate OPML files, generate error logs, or transform outline data for external processing.

Processes XML validation results by converting internal exceptions into readable error messages, leveraging position and content data. Provides types for tracking XML positions and error messages, along with functions to transform and display them. Enables detailed reporting by mapping validation failures to specific document locations. For example, it can take a validation error and output a message like "Line 12, Column 5: Unknown element 'foo'".

Provides date comparison, arithmetic, and formatting operations. Works with a date type representing instants in time and a month enumeration. Converts dates to and from RFC 822 and RFC 3339 string formats, extracts components like year, month, and day, and returns month names in English.

Resolves URIs using a base URI and a relative URI, and converts XML documents between internal representations and XML streams. It handles XML parsing and serialization, working with DTDs, positions, tags, and XML trees. It supports generating XML output from a tree and converting trees to strings or buffers with namespace prefix handling.

Parses RSS and Atom feed formats into structured data, extracting titles, links, and entries. Processes XML nodes and handles namespace-specific elements during parsing. Enables retrieval of feed metadata and item content for application-specific processing.

Tracks XML positions and generates human-readable error messages across parsing, validation, and processing tasks. Provides types for positions and error messages, along with functions to format, display, and map errors to specific document locations. Supports operations like parsing OPML, validating XML, and resolving URIs, with examples including reporting malformed tags in Atom feeds or unknown elements in RSS 2.0. Also includes date manipulation and XML serialization capabilities.
